text: Joseph Kain (December 4, 1854-May 3, 1907) was an American businessman and politician. Kain was born in Kilwinning, Scotland. In 1861, he emigrated with his parents to the United States and settled in Pennsylvania. In 1866, Kain and his parents settled in Braidwood, Illinois. Kain owned a furniture store in Braidwood. He also was involved with the funeral home, livery and stable businesses in Braidwood. Kain served on the Kane County Board of Supervisors and was a Democrat. He served in the Illinois House of Representatives in 1897 and 1898. Kain died in Chicago, Illinois.'Official Directory of the Fortieth General Assembly of Illinois 1897,' J.L. Pickeing-editor, Illinois State Register Press, Springfield, Illinois: 1897, Biographical Sketch of Joseph Kain, pg. 4'Sudden Death In Chicago of Ex-Representative Joseph Kain,' The Joliet News (Illinois), May 4, 1907, pg. 2 ==Notes== ==External links== * Category:1854 births Category:1907 deaths Category:Scottish emigrants to the United States Category:People from Kilwinning Category:People from Braidwood, Illinois Category:Businesspeople from Illinois Category:Illinois Democrats Category:County board members in Illinois Category:Members of the Illinois House of Representatives
title: Joseph Kain
